RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JERSEYS IMAGE away alertly and dueled for the lead through the first turn and in the run down the backside from the outside of SHE'S ON FIRE, continued to battle with that rival into the final turn, took command entering the lane, and inched clear in the drive. DYNAMITER tracked the dueling leader in the run down the backside while racing just out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. ENGLISH BAY TEDDY away well and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while drifting three out from the rail, continued to fight the rider while racing four wide in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive in an even effort. SHE'S ON FIRE broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail in the run to the first turn, steadied briefly entering the turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, checked again leaving the turn when in tight quarters at the rail, and was outfinished late. BE SPARKY unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, saved ground throughout, but failed to make a serious impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamiter
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: She's On Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, checked 5/8, rallied rail, check 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Jerseys Image
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, led, inched clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: R. McLellan & Mr. & Mrs. H. J. Barroby

ENTRY.NAME: English Bay Teddy
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3w, rallied 3w, closed 3w

ENTRY.NAME: Be Sparky
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $4,375 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,0 00 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHARPZAN broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of DON W entering the first turn, forced the issue from the outside of that rival in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, got the better of his pace rival entering the lane, was quickly collared by BROKE AN BROKEN and briefly overtaken, but battled back gamely to prevail following a stretch long battle. BROKE AN BROKEN away alertly and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, tipped three wide to commence his bid entering the final turn, took a narrow advantage soon after straightening for home, but was unable to dispose of a stubborn SHARPZAN who battled back along the inside to prevail. COCORITA tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backside while racing two out from the rail, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and finished with late interest three out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. ONE FIFTY ONE stalked the leaders at the back of a compact field while saving ground in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive while unable to make a serious impact. DON W away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, was unable to match strides with his pace rival leaving the turn, and faded in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Don W
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied rail, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: One Fifty One
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Sharpzan
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2w, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Broke an Broken
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 w, rallied 3 w, closed 3 w, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Cocorita
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Purse 22000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KAPALUA CANDY away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of ALOBRAH entering the first turn, quickly took command and controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch, held a clear lead into the final turn, and drew off in the lane under confident handling. MARYS TAPPIN SHOES away well and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail, rallied from just off the rail entering the final turn, and found her best stride late from along the rail to get up for the place. VIVA LA VINO tossed her head prior to the start and got away a step slowly, raced into a stalking trip two out from the rail entering the backstretch, began to advance midway down the backside to take up the chase three wide entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive while unable to sustain her bi in the late stages. OSTRACIZE settled off the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive while unable to threaten. ALOBRAH broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, was unable to keep tabs on her pace rival in the run down the backside, and faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Alobrah
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, tracked inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Marys Tappin Shoes
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Viva La Vino
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, stalked 3 wide, advanced 3/8, rallied 3w, closed 3 w,

ENTRY.NAME: Kapalua Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, led, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Ostracize
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 22 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Rac e Since March 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IMA DAREDEVIL away alertly and tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly three wide entering the final turn, wept to the lead three wide entering the lane, and inched clear late. KANDY KATIE vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of ANIMA in the run down the backside and through the final turn, and gave way grudgingly in the lane, while fending off her pace rival for the place. ANIMA broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of KANDY KATIE entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and from between rivals through the final turn, and finished three wide in the lane to garner a share. BAKZONE tracked the leaders while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, continued to save ground while unable to gain ground on the leaders through the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive in an even effort. HARLAN'S ANGEL raced into a stalking trip while racing four wide in the run down the backstretch, continued with a wide trip into the final turn, and failed to make a late impact while finishing seven wide in the drive. STORM CRUISER unhurried early while dropping back to trail, was always well back, and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Bakzone
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail, evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Kandy Katie
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied rail, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Ima Daredevil
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2w, rallied 3w, closed 3w, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Anima
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Cruiser
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Harlan's Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 7 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, if for $45,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $62,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JOSE JOSE away alertly while breaking inwards in the opening strides before asserting himself on the lead in the run to the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch while well in hand, opened a clear advantage approaching the final turn, and widened his margin over the final furlong under confident handling. BAK TO LIBERTY was fractious prior to the start, and was pushed in slightly in the opening strides, but quickly recovered and tracked the leader into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, continued to track the pacesetter into the backstretch, was unable to keep tabs on that foe nearing the final turn, but finished one out from the rail in the drive to prove clearly second best. CAIRO CRUSADER broke sharply while breaking inwards in the opening strides, tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished willingly from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. MAGIC ROAD stalked the early pace while racing three wide into the backstretch, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished with late interest two wide in the drive. TAPITS CHOICE steadied when pushed in at the start, saved ground while in a stalking position entering the first turn, but steadied off heels midway through the turn, saved ground throughout, but failed to make a late impact. UNION MAN tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, dropped back approaching the final turn, and had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Tapits Choice
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, Gary C., Pumpkin Stable and Sharlea Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied early, stalked rail, checked 1/2, saved ground

ENTRY.NAME: Cairo Crusader
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Bak to Liberty
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Jose Jose
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Road
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Union Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, if for $45,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $62,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FREESTYLE away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of VIVA CON WOW entering the first turn, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, took command entering the turn, and repelled a strong bid by FANNY BAY ALI to prevail. FANNY BAY ALI stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing three out from the rail, pulled her way into a tracking trip four wide in the run to the final turn, continued strongly through the turn and collared the leader entering the lane, and just missed following a stretch long battle. ARUNDEL CASTLE settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, split rivals two wide leaving the turn, and closed determinedly three wide in the drive to prove best of the rest. ELLAMEISTER unhurried early while dropping back to trail, launched her bid three wide entering the final turn, and continued on gamely through the stretch while improving her position. VIVA CON WOW rushed up along the rail to vie for the lead entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, was unable to match strides with her pace rival entering the turn, and faded over the final furlong. LICORICE was fractious prior to the start, but broke sharply and tracked the leaders entering the first turn while exchanging bumps with CHI CHI'S SONG, held a tracking trip in the run to the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong. CHI CHI'S SONG hit the gate at the start, and scrambled in the opening strides, held a tracking position in the run to the first turn, and exchanged bumps with LICORICE entering the turn, maintained a tracking trip into the backstretch, but began to weaken midway to the final turn, and had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Fanny Bay Ali
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Viva Con Wow
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Chi Chi's Song
ENTRY.OWNER: Forster Stable and Blue Willow Dairy Ltd
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate, bumped 5/8, tracked, through early

ENTRY.NAME: Licorice
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious, broke sharply, bumped 5/8, tracked, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Freestyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Ellameister
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Arundel Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Lyle Johnson Mark V and Harding Clive
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $4,900 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.Non-winners Of A Race Since April 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $8,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Colu mbia Bred Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VALUABLE COWBOY broke sharply and raced to the lead from just off the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, held a clear advantage into the lane, but was all out to fend off the late bid by TIZ VICIOUS and LAUGH WITH ME to prevail. TIZ VICIOUS tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed with a rush three wide in deep stretch to just miss. LAUGH WITH ME away well and tracked the leader into the backside while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, tipped off the rail in mid stretch and closed with a rush from between rivals in the closing strides to just miss. DRILLER stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished evenly from along the inside in the stretch drive. SLEW'S DA BOSS settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly along the rail entering the final turn, and finished with late interest three wide in the lane. JUST MAKE BELIEVE away alertly and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing three out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but faded in the late going. ARCH PRINCE unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and found his best stride late, while unable to mount a serious late bid. BABY GRAND was fractious prior to the start, and unprepared as the gates opened to get away poorly, was always well back and never a factor. Following the race the stewards conducted an inquiry into the start. After review it was deemed that BABY GRAND was not afforded a fair start, and declared this horse a non starter.

ENTRY.NAME: Laugh With Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 2w, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz Vicious
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Slew's Da Boss
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Mel Corsan Doug and Houweling Len
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Valuable Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led inside, rallied inside, held

ENTRY.NAME: Just Make Believe
ENTRY.OWNER: Last Call Racing Stable and Bornn Cathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Arch Prince
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Grand
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared start, declared non starter

ENTRY.NAME: Driller
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed inside
